item.title: DEBIAS invited to a UN Committee of Experts
item.dc:creator: Francisco Rowe
item.description: Francisco has been invited to the United Nations Committee of Experts on Big Data and Data Science for Official Statistics. He will be contributing to the task team on Mobile Phone Data for Official Statistics and Policy, leading the task team on Migration Statistics and contributing to the Synthetic Mobile Phone Data group.

item.title: Logo for DEBIAS
item.dc:creator: Francisco Rowe
item.description: We are happy to unveil the logo for DEBIAS. Let us unpack what the logo represents. We have chosen an iceberg as a logo as it provides an effective representation of what we can see from smart data from digital sources in their raw form, and the parts that we do not see given their limited capacity to offer a representation of the full population. DEBIAS seeks to mitigate biases present in smart data from digital sources and move us closer to get a population-level representation.

item.title: Kicking off
item.dc:creator: Francisco Rowe
item.description: This is the first post going out form the DEBIAS project. We will use this blog to keep track of progress on the project and to announce milestones of the project along the way. If you are interested in human mobility, smart data from digital sources (including mobile phone data), geographic data science and AI, keep an eye on the blog and feel free to get in touch with Francisco and / or Carmen!
